title: Tour de France 2021 Standings after Stage 6
content:
General Classification / Yellow Jersey

A flat sprint stage meant that there was no movement in the General Classification in Stage 6. All of the main contenders for yellow finished safely in the main peloton, but the big mountains are likely to shake things up over the coming days.

1. Mathieu van der Poel
2. Tadej Pogacar +0:08
3. Wout Van Aert +0:30
4. Julian Alaphilippe +0:48
5. Alexey Lutsenko +1:21
6. Pierre Latour +1:28
7. Rigoberto Uran +1:29
8. Jonas Vingegaard +1:43
9. Richard Carapaz +1.44
10. Primož Roglič +1.48

Tour de France 2021 Guide

Points Classification / Green Jersey

The Manx Missile took the stage win again in Châteauroux, cementing his lead in the Green jersey competition. Things got a bit hairy at the intermediate sprint point earlier in the stage, with all of the sprinters barging towards the line, aiming pick up the sprint for third behind the two men in the breakaway. Cavendish picked up 9 points, finishing 5th from the bunch. This was still enough for him to hold on to the jersey, though.

1. Mark Cavendish - 148 points
2. Jasper Philipsen - 102 points
3. Nacer Bouhanni - 99 points
4. Michael Matthews - 96 points
5. Julian Alaphilippe - 84 points

King of the Mountains Classification / Polka-Dot Jersey

Greg Van Avermaet took the single KOM in stage 6 as he led the way over the day's only climb with 87km to go, but this didn't change the overall standings for the competition.

1. Ide Schelling - 5 points
2. Mathieu van der Poel - 4 points
3. Anthony Perez - 3 points
4. Julian Alaphilippe - 2 points
5. Edward Theuns - 2 points

Young Rider's Classification / White Jersey

The white jersey remains, unsurprisingly, with Pogačar after the today's sprint stage.

1. Tadej Pogačar
2. Jonas Vingegaard +1:35
3. David Gaudu +2:27
4. Sergio Higuita +2:58
5. Lucas Hamilton +3:51

Team Classification

1. Team Jumbo-Visma
2. EF Education - Nippo +2:25
3. Bahrain - Victorious +3:02
4. Astana - Premier Tech +3:23
5. Deceuninck–Quick-Step +3:25

Cover image: A.S.O./Alex Broadway
author: Peter Stuart
